person.persName: Samuel M. Letcher, Jr. (Lexington, KY, clerk; pvt 21st Ky Inf; capt and major in 12th Ky Inf. USA)

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Samuel M. Letcher, Sr. and Ellen M. Letcher. Student in Lexington in 1850. Household owned six enslaved persons in Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1850. Clerk in Lexington in 1860. Household owned five enslaved persons in Lexington in 1860. Served in the 21st Kentucky Volunter Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from October 21, 1861, to January 2, 1862. Served in the 12th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain and major from June 15, 1862, to August 1, 1865. Appointed brevet colonel on July 15, 1865.
